column2: Set of popular abbreviations used in my place of work.

column3: Trigger for "immediate execute" triggerstrings: "/". For "immediate execute" triggerstrings frequently used "not case-conforming" C1 option.

column2: Special triggerstrings: d(t, o, h): d(.ahk, B0?, ) (empty hotstring), works as file extension.

*‖ga/‖MSI‖En‖Generic Application¦generische Anwendung¦product independent of application, fulfilling predefined boundary conditions, interfaces and functionality (black box). Example: Examples point machines, axle counters, real-time operating systems, fail-safe computer platform without application software.¦SOURCE: IEC 60050-821:FDIS2016, 821-01-57‖
*‖iris/‖CL‖En‖International Railway Industry Standard for the evaluation of railway management systems‖
*‖md5/‖MSI‖En‖Message-Digest Algorithm¦hash function producing a 128-bit hash value‖

*‖mtbf/‖MSI‖En‖Mean Time Between Failures¦the predicted elapsed time between inherent failures of a mechanical or electronic system, during normal system operation. MTBF can be calculated as the arithmetic mean (average) time between failures of a system. The term is used for repairable systems, while mean time to failure (MTTF) denotes the expected time to failure for a non-repairable system.`n[SOURCE: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mean_time_between_failures]`n‖
*‖mttf/‖MSI‖En‖Mean Time To Failure¦the expected time to failure for a non-repairable system.`n[SOURCE: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mean_time_between_failures]`n‖
*‖otp/‖MSI‖En‖One-Time Password¦is a password that is valid for only one login session or transaction, on a computer system or other digital device‖

*‖pnp/‖MSI‖En‖device with a specification that facilitates the discovery of a hardware component in a system without the need for physical device configuration or user intervention in resolving resource conflicts¦Plug and Play‖
*‖ral/‖SI‖En‖Reichs-Ausschuß für Lieferbedingungen (National Committee for Delivery and Quality Assurance)‖
*‖rsa/‖MSI‖En‖Rivest–Shamir–Adleman¦a public-key cryptosystem that is widely used for secure data transmission‖

C‖sil‖MSI‖En‖SIL¦number which indicates the required degree of confidence that a system will meet its specified safety functions with respect to systematic failures`n[SOURCE: IEC 62280:2014, 3.1.50]¦Safety Integrity Level‖

*‖srac/‖MCL‖En‖Safety Related Application Condition¦Those conditions which need to be met in order for a system to be safely integrated and safely operated. Note 1 to entry: Application conditions can for example be: operational restrictions (e.g. speed limit, maximum duration of use), operational rules, maintenance restrictions (e.g. requested maintenance intervals) or environmental conditions.‖
‖ssh/‖MSI‖En‖Secure Shell¦a cryptographic network protocol for operating network services securely over an unsecured network‖

*‖tsi/‖MCL‖En‖Technical Specifications for Interoperability¦„techniczne specyfikacje interoperacyjności” (TSI) oznaczają specyfikacje przyjęte zgodnie z niniejszą dyrektywą, obejmujące każdy z podsystemów lub część podsystemu celem spełnienia zasadniczych wymagań oraz zapewnienia interoperacyjności systemu kolei Unii [ŹRÓDŁO: Dyrektywa (UE) 2016/797, art. 2, 11)]‖
